titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that Social Security should be maintained and protected.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 6/14/1995--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) social security should be maintained; and (2) reforms should be made not to pay for tax cuts or meet short-term budget targets, but only to strengthen and preserve the long-term integrity of the program.
